org.biopcd.widgets

Class FileChooser

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.biopcd.widgets.SimpleWidget
      • org.biopcd.widgets.TextWidget
        • org.biopcd.widgets.AbstractFileChooser
          • org.biopcd.widgets.FileChooser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Widget

    public class FileChooser
extends AbstractFileChooser
    A wrapper class used to abstract file selection within command windows.
    Author:
    Graham Alvare, Brian Fristensky
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • WIDGET_ICON

        public static final javax.swing.Icon WIDGET_ICON
        The icon for the widget

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileChooser

        public FileChooser(java.lang.String name)
        Creates a new instance of a file chooser widget (this specific constructor is used by the PCD editor ONLY!).
        Parameters:
        name - the PCD variable name (this name can be referenced in the command using the % symbol; for example, if the name value was set to "A", the value of this widget could be accessed by using %A% (lower or upper-case) within the PCD menu command string.

      • FileChooser

        public FileChooser(java.lang.String name,
                   java.lang.String label,
                   java.lang.String value)
        Creates a new instance of a file chooser widget.
        Parameters:
        name - the PCD variable name (this name can be referenced in the command using the % symbol; for example, if the name value was set to "A", the value of this widget could be accessed by using %A% (lower or upper-case) within the PCD menu command string.
        label - the label to display representing the parameter to be manipulated by the number widget. This is the text the user will see to the left of the widget in any BioLegato menu windows.
        value - the default value for the file chooser

    • Method Detail

      • pcdOut

        public void pcdOut(int scope,
                   java.lang.Appendable out)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the BioPCD representation of the menu widget to a writer object (see BioLegato's BioPCD editor for more details)
        Specified by:
        pcdOut in interface Widget
        Overrides:
        pcdOut in class TextWidget
        Parameters:
        scope - the level of scope to write the menu widget. In the case of PCD, the scope of each line is indicated by the number of spaced preceding the line. Every 4 spaces count as one level of scope (any number not divisible by 4 is considered an error), thus if a line is preceded by 4 spaces, its scope level is considered to be 1
        out - the Appendable object to output the BioPCD code.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
